intro: Aspilia andrade-limae, commonly known as the Andrade-Lima aspilia, is a flowering plant species native to Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces yellow to orange composite flowers that attract pollinators. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Aspilia andrade-limae is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
